definition: to write down/to record/written account
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

sentences.english: The court recorded a plea of not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 法院对无罪抗辩作了记载。

sentences.english: As early as the "Huang Di Nei Jing" there are records.
sentences.chinese: 早在《黄帝内经》就有记载。

sentences.english: Some records, make up the history books of the palace.
sentences.chinese: 有些记载，弥补了史书之阙。

sentences.english: Many of his records in the Negro League were never recorded.
sentences.chinese: 但他在联盟中的许多记录均未能记载下来。

sentences.english: North entrance to the embedded Taming stone, quite detailed records.
sentences.chinese: 门外北向嵌有塔铭刻石，记载颇详。

sentences.english: It is a book that records the fall of the Third Reich.
sentences.chinese: 它是一本记载第三帝国衰亡的书。

sentences.english: And Luke recorded that in his gospel.
sentences.chinese: 而路加在他的福音里记载了这点。

sentences.english: Historydoesn't record what Reilly did with the money.
sentences.chinese: 历史书中并未记载下赖利如何处理的这笔钱。

sentences.english: This was an inside job, according to court documents.
sentences.chinese: 据法院档案记载，这是一种监守自盗行为。

sentences.english: Here he would jump on unsuspecting passersby, as Xenophon records.
sentences.chinese: 据色诺顿的记载，他会向毫无准备的路人发问。

sentences.english: By Egyptian record, Keftiu was destroyed by the seas in an apocalypse.
sentences.chinese: 依照埃及人记载，克弗悌乌在一次天启中被海洋毁灭。

sentences.english: According to the archives, our Chinese ancestors began using stilts to help them gather fruits from trees.
sentences.chinese: 根据记载，我们的祖先踩高跷是为了从树上摘果子。

sentences.english: Three times the Bible recorded the water got healed, all because of God's sovereignty.
sentences.chinese: 圣经三次记载水得医治，都是出于神的主权。

sentences.english: According to records, in 554 AD Ireland will hold across the River game.
sentences.chinese: 据记载，公元554年爱尔兰就有撑越过河的游戏。

sentences.english: A number of ancient books ever recorded the "leaf whistling" technique.
sentences.chinese: 关于“木叶”艺术，古代典籍多所记载。

sentences.english: According to the historical record, the custom of tea-drinking occurred in the Wesrern Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 据史料记载，西汉时期已经有了饮茶的习俗。

definition: to write an account (of events)
historical records
history book

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
general history of a county/county annals
Compendium of Medical Herbs 1596, compiled by Li Shizhen 李時珍|李时珍[Li3 Shi2 zhen1]
historical material or data
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Imperial Readings of the Taiping Era, general Song dynasty encyclopedia compiled during 977-983 under Li Fang 李昉[Li3 Fang3], 1000 scrolls
to pass on/to hand down/tradition has it that .../according to legend
History of the Sui Dynasty, thirteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Wei Zheng 魏徵|魏征[Wei4 Zheng1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 85 scrolls
the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Extensive records of the Taiping era (978), fictional history edited by Li Fang 李昉

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
